greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = n*A237048(n,k).
comment: Conjecture: T(n,k) = n, is also the sum of the parts of the partition of n into k consecutive parts, if such a partition exists, otherwise T(n,k) = 0.
program: tabf(nn) = {for (n=1, nn, for (k=1, floor((sqrt(1+8*n)-1)/2), print1(n*t(n, k), ", "); ); print(); ); } \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 04 2019
xref: Column k starts in row A000217(k).
The number of positive terms in row n is A001227(n), the number of partitions of n into consecutive parts.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, May 02 2017
